block.p: Eleanor Hope Acquavella, the daughter of Hope Brown and William R. Acquavella, both of New York, was married yesterday to Morgan Andre Grace Dejoux, a son of Mrs. William H. Brinckerhoff of Palm Beach, Fla., and Jacques H. Dejoux of Lyon, France. The Rev. Robert Pollard III performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Dejoux, 26, is the treasurer of Acquavella Galleries in New York, which specializes in 19th- and 20th-century European art. She graduated from Denison University. Her father is the president of Acquavella Galleries. Her mother is an art therapist at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Donna J. Acquavella.

Eleanor Hope Acquavella, the daughter of Hope Brown and William R. Acquavella, both of New York, was married yesterday to Morgan Andre Grace Dejoux, a son of Mrs. William H. Brinckerhoff of Palm Beach, Fla., and Jacques H. Dejoux of Lyon, France. The Rev. Robert Pollard III performed the ceremony at St. John's Episcopal Church in Southampton, N.Y.

Mrs. Dejoux, 26, is the treasurer of Acquavella Galleries in New York, which specializes in 19th- and 20th-century European art. She graduated from Denison University. Her father is the president of Acquavella Galleries. Her mother is an art therapist at Mount Sinai Hospital in New York. The bride is the stepdaughter of Donna J. Acquavella.

Mr. Dejoux, 29, is an analyst in Brookville, N.Y., for the Sterling Grace Corporation, an investment company. He is a graduate of the University of Vermont. His father is the director of risk management at the Luxembourg subsidiary of Dexia, a French-Belgian bank.
